metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5667 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML-Scrubber module before 0.15 for Perl, when the comment feature is enabled, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted comment. It was discovered that the Perl HTML-Scrubber module incorrectly handles comments. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhtml-scrubber-perl - 0.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libhtml-scrubber-perl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.15-1').
